page.title: 03WHERE ARE WE ? (TWO)
page.content: Where the land has remained with small farm owners,the rough pastureland has been retained as in the land to the south of Orton and in the northwest corner in Austrey Meadows.Orton at 325feet commands a panoramic view of the surround land.From its unique position you can see the four counties of Leicestershire,Warwickshire, Derbyshire and Staffordshire.You can see the village of Warton,with its tightly packed houses,its trees and the road ribboning towards the{village of Austrey nearby is the plantation,a wood consisting of deciduous trees. This is one of the many{ancient } coverts in this area.To preserve the { {ecology}of the area and sport for landowners.The {local history}of both villages is documented in saxon times. Orton having an entry in the Domesday Book of 1086.
